title: Pioneer Library System
name: Pioneer Library System
description:
A Map by Owwl

A map of the Pioneer Library System

properties.name: Avon Free Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  143 Genesee Street 14414The purpose of the Avon Free Library outlined in its New York State charter is to provide for the citizens of the Avon Community, a circulating library and reading room as well as space for community meetings and social activities, compatible with library programs and schedules. In addition, the mission of the library is to secure free access to current reliable information of interest to all ages in an atmosphere that encourages an interest in reading and learning, regardless of ethnic background, religion, sex, age, or physical disabilities. This will be done according to policies established by the Library\'s Board of Trustees.

properties.name: Bell Memorial Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl 16 East Street 14517Bell Memorial Library\'s mission is to provide a full range of library services to all residents of the 1989 chartered service area regardless of one\'s race, creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation or disability. The library will provide materials, services and programs to all.

properties.name: Gorham Free Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl 2664 Main Street 14461Gorham Free Library was chartered as a free association library by the State of New York in 1914. Gorham Free Library is housed in one of the oldest buildings in the hamlet of Gorham. The former Presbyterian Church was built in 1862. The library moved into the building in 1968. It is also home of the Gorham Historical Society. The library is often the central meeting place of this small hamlet. We are committed to serving as a lifelong center for learning, information gathering, and leisure reading for those of all ages in the community.

properties.name: Honeoye Public Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  8708 Main St 14471The Honeoye Public Library is an integral part of the community, providing books and other sources of interest, information and enlightenment of people of all ages. We are committed to providing the public with popular materials, a "doorway to learning," and community services.

properties.name: Lyons Public Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  67 Canal Street, Lyons, New York 14489The Lyons School District Public Library provides a variety of print and media resources on a free loan or on-site basis to meet the recreational, educational, informational, and cultural needs of area residents and encourages non-users to partake of our services. The library provides resources beyond its own by cooperating with other libraries and agencies

properties.name: Naples Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  118 South Main St 14512The Naples Library, located in the picturesque village of Naples, NY, is a public lending library; a member of the Pioneer Library System. At the Naples Library, patrons have access to a range of books, resources, public computers, videos, and local historical records. Stop by the Library at 118 South Main St., and see what there is to read and do. Check the online schedules for the dates of various programs sponsored by the Library.

properties.name: Perry Public Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl   70 N. Main Street 14530The Perry Public Library was completed and opened in 1914 through a grant from the Andrew Carnegie Corporation. It was originally chartered to serve the residents of the Town of Perry. On October 4, 2002, the Board of Regents of the State of New York granted the library a new charter designating the Perry Central School District as the library\'s chartered service area. (Click on New Charter for details about the formation of the new district.)

properties.name: Phelps Community Memorial Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  8 Banta St 14532

properties.name: Pioneer Library System Headquarters
properties.description: Posted by Owwl4595 Chapin Rd 14424-8708 The Pioneer Library System (PLS) is a New York State chartered, cooperative public library system serving the forty-two public libraries in Livingston, Ontario, Wayne and Wyoming counties. One of twenty-three public library systems in New York State it was created to enhance the service of, and promote cooperation among, its member libraries.

properties.name: Red Jacket Community Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl 1506 Rt. 21 14548The Red Jacket Community Library is a combined school and public library. Established in 1998 as a School District Public Library, it is located in the Red Jacket Central School Building and serves the Manchester-Shortsville (Red Jacket) School District. The High School, Elementary, and Public Libraries share collections and facilities to the benefit of all.

properties.name: Rose Free Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl 4069 State Route 414 Rose, Ny

properties.name: Sodua Free Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl 17 Maple Avenue 14551The Sodus Free Library serves people of all ages, provides materials, programs, information and services to meet community needs.

properties.name: Victor Free Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  15 West Main Street 14564Like many institutions, public libraries have changed a great deal over the years. They are no longer places of reverential quiet. The library now echoes the chatter of children and the quieter clatter of computer keyboards. The library is many things to many people. It provides to toddlers and to grandparents, all seeking timely and accurate information, a quiet place to study, or just a good book to listen or read. New technologies are changing the way information is provided. But contrary to dire predictions of the demise of the printed word, more books are being published than ever before. Your new library is a gathering place for the community and an important facet of the educational network. With the new library building finally a reality, our challenge now is to balance the traditional role of the library as a haven for book lovers, while expanding the electronic resources needed to cope with an increasingly technological society.

properties.name: Wadsworth Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl 24 Center Street 14454The Wadsworth Library welcomes and supports all community members in their enjoyment of reading and pursuit of lifelong learning. We strive to provide free and open access to information, ideas and knowledge through books, programs, technology and other resources. We encourage and foster reading, learning and discovery.

properties.name: Walworth-Seely Public Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  3600 Lorraine Drive 14568The Walworth-Seely Public Library will provide traditional and innovative services in a warm and friendly environment; offer programs for all ages, birth and up; offer materials in all formats that serve patrons reading and reference needs; use technology that enhances patrons’ speedy retrieval of information and materials in a facility that is both inviting and conductive to good service; and provide free and equal services in the Walworth community.

properties.name: Warsaw Public Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  130 N. Main Street 14569Warsaw Public Library provides both print and non-print materials and services to community residents to help meet their informational and recreational needs. The library is committed to identifying user groups with special needs and providing special collections and services to these individuals.

properties.name: Williamson Free Public Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  6380 Rt. 21, Suite 1 Williamson, NY 14589-9560

properties.name: Wolcott Civic Free Library
properties.description: Posted by Owwl 5890 New Hartford Street 14590The Wolcott Library offers many services and resources to Wolcott, NY and surrounding areas. Books, magazines, newspapers, videos, audio recordings, seven Internet-connected computers are available for public use.

properties.name: Wood Library Association
properties.description: Posted by Owwl  134 N. Main Street 14424Wood Library is located in the City of Canandaigua, the Ontario County seat, in the beautiful Finger Lakes Region of New York State. A few years ago Canandaigua residents reported in a survey on small cities that they felt very connected to the world outside their small city. As Canandaigua’s public library, Wood Library is proud to be an important link in that global connection. While many of our services and programs take place within the "bricks and mortar" library located at 134 North Main Street in Canandaigua, others reach far beyond its walls.

properties.name: Wyoming Free Circulating Library System
properties.description: Posted by Owwl 114 S. Academy Street 14591Wyoming Free Library provides and maintains a facility dedicated to promoting an environment which encourages all community members to utilize its programs and resources (1) to enhance their general and specific topic knowledge for personal and educational needs, and (2) for recreational purposes. The Wyoming Free Library is here to serve YOU! Our goal is to stimulate an interest in reading in all age levels, from the very young to the young at heart!
